sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As Israel pounds the southern Gaza Strip, the United States says too many civilians are being killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN Children's Agency describes the assault on Gaza as a war on children, saying more than 5,000 have already been killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 50 oil companies that are responsible for half the world's oil production, 50 oil companies that are responsible for half the world's oil production pledged to reach near zero methane emissions by 2030. That was Israeli warplanes destroying a housing complex in Hamad city on the outskirts of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Khan Yunis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, Israel said it hit around 50 other targets around the city in southern Gaza and more than 400 targets across the Gaza Strip altogether.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, it dropped maps and leaflets ordering more neighborhoods in the south to evacuate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They generated panic and confusion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Unable to go to northern Gaza as it's too dangerous, or neighboring Egypt as the border is closed to them, there is nowhere safe for people to flee to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Since the war resumed on Friday, at least 200 Palestinians have been killed. Israel's closest ally, the United States, and many other Western countries are now saying too many civilians are being killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN Children's Agency, UNICEF, has called it a war on children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It says more than 5,000 have already been killed and thousands more injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: One reason for that high rate is that children make up around 40% of the population in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Another is that it's a very densely populated area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We cannot see more children with the wounds of war, with the burns, with the shrapnel littering their body, with the broken bones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Inaction by those with influence is allowing the killing of children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is a war on children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Over 1.7 million Garcins have had to flee their homes, roughly half of them children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now they don't have enough clean water, food, fuel or medicine, and they also remain trapped inside the Gaza Strip, as all the border crossings into either Egypt or Israel are effectively closed to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Fifty oil companies, which are responsible for half the world's production,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: have pledged to reach near zero methane emissions by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But the headline grabbing pledge that's come out of COP28 was dismissed as a smokescreen by environmental groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If it happens, the pledge would trim about a tenth of a degree Celsius from future warming, a prominent climate scientist told the Associated Press.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the EU pledged to invest 2.3 billion euros to move away from fossil fuels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Ursula von der Leyen urged the world to switch to renewable energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We must roll out more renewables and we must use less energy to produce the products and the services we need and the world's cheapest energy source are renewables also on Saturday US climate envoy John Kerry joined French presidents Emmanuel Macron in pushing for more nuclear energy which doesn't produce greenhouse gas emissions even though accidents are potentially catastrophic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And a group of more than 20 nations called for a tripling of nuclear energy generated in the world by 2050. Winter has arrived in Central Europe with heavy snowfall sweeping through the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Germany, Austria and Switzerland are the worst affected countries so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Flights at Munich airport remain grounded until 6 am on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The city's bus, streetcar and S-Bahn services have come to a standstill and police are advising locals against driving.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The heavy snowfall has also caused traffic blockages in southern Germany with major disruptions to all public transport services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Residents of Bavaria were seen clearing the snow off their cars and roads. It's always like this, you know, with climate change, now we have very hot weather and then we have a lot of snow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It was a similar situation in the Czech Republic, where heavy snow blocked roads and railways and disrupted the electrical grid, with some homes experiencing power cuts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Officials in Austria and Switzerland have issued warnings about increased risks of avalanches in the mountains.
